climbs.name: Wonderbar
climbs.fa: Tony Puppo and Grant Schumacher, June 1992

content.description: A short, steep and sustained 4 bolt climb.  Powerful moves past the last bolt.  Great rock.
content.location: This climb is located left of Gary Gray on a short pillar and faces north.

content.description: Cruxes above  the 2nd bolt and at the bulge 1/3 of the way up.  a 70m rope stretcher.  As good a rock quality as any route on the main PUB formation, much better than "Belayer Slayer".  An excellent and long warm-up. Many big holds!
content.location: between "Light Within" and "Belayer Slayer". Climb up easy slab and stem left to clip the 1st bolt.

climbs.name: Set Free
climbs.fa: Tony Puppo and Joe Rousek, February 1994

content.description: Follow the crack system near the arete left of Light Within. Moves are more varied and interesting than its neighbor, although the rock is a little less stellar at times. Great exposure!
content.protection: 8 bolts, some type of convenience anchor (don't remember if chains or mussy hooks)

content.description: Fun, if a tad discontinuous (let's call it varied), climbing.  Good for warming up or for the young leader.
Fun roof climb to the left of Hammered on the Pub Wall.
content.location: Three Mussy hooks to lower off.

climbs.name: Light Within
climbs.fa: joe Rousek, Gary Slate, Jim Stimson

content.description: The awesome vertical face.  Sustained and classic.

climbs.name: Hungover
climbs.fa: Gary Slate, Charlie Johnson, Marty Lewis - May, 1991

content.description:
This line is just right of

Hardly Wallbanger

(5.10c).  It is slightly shorter but a little harder.  There is a hard section pulling a roof, but the pump factor on the upper part of the climb is probably the real crux.

climbs.name: High Ball
climbs.fa: Todd Graham and Bruce Lella, June 1991

content.description: Just right of Hungover.. After scrambling up to the ledge, climb a steep flake to vertical face with ever thinning holds. Crux right before the anchor. Can traverse right to the anchor of Menace to Sobriety, thus avoiding the top crux, @11a

Steep and engaging, good holds abounding,  energy conservation is the principal challenge.  Two cruxes -- clipping the bolt right above the roof, and then passing the 7th bolt.

After clipping the 8th: a long move left to an obvious shelf/hold leads to much easier climbing above.  Going straight up is harder (11d).
content.location: The line of bolts just left of Hardly Wallbanger.

climbs.name: Hardly Wallbanger
climbs.fa: Bruce Lella, Marty Lewis, & Fred Berman - November, 1992

content.description: On the main face of the Pub Wall there are three or four lines.  This one climbs the face just right of the wide crack past a couple bolts to a rest ledge.  From here follow the thin crack and face up the slightly overhanging wall to an anchor.
content.protection: 10Â draws or so. Originally led on natural gear.

content.description: The furthest right route on the front wall of the Pub, just left of the arete. Climb some interesting off-vertical moves down low (5.9ish) to easy scramble to the big ledge. Then, get ready! Clip the first bolt with a long sling to reduce rope drag, then cast off up the steep jugs and slopers above, past three small roofs to the anchor. The crux comes at the last roof, just before the last bolt, and if you're pumped the clip might seem hard! Don't worry, nothing but air below you!
Climb Highball, but go right at the 8th bolt to the anchors of Menace to Sobriety.

This prominent, vertical arete is definitely out of character with the other jug hauls at the Pub.  Jugs are definitely not a theme on this route.  The hard moves start immediately with a strange press with the left arm to gain the crimps.  Hard moves using the crimps and the arete lead up to slightly easier climbing.  As the rock gets even chossier, move back right to the arete and at the last bolt move around the arete, running it out a long way on jugs to the anchors.  The rock is not very good and the climbing is contrived as you attempt to avoid the tempting lefthand arete/crack.

climbs.name: Gary Gray
climbs.fa: Mike Strassman, Paul Linaweaver, Scott Ayers & Austin Hearst,  9/91

content.description: This excellent long face climb is left of Abitarot on a narrow face with several large blocks at the base.  Easy climbing up the blocks leads to a high first bolt.  Tricky climbing up to the third bolt with a hard clip.  Cruise up to and pass a small roof 5.10a that has big holds just out of easy reach.

climbs.name: Belayer Slayer
climbs.fa: Kelly Cordner, Theresa Otto, Derik Olso

content.description: crux is at between bolt 16 and the anchors. This is a 70 meter rope stretcher!!!  Lots of climbing in the 5.8 to 5.9 range. a bit chaucey on the right side in places.
content.location:
to the right of

Set Free

and

Light Within

climbs.name: Abitafun
climbs.fa: John Hoffman, Annie Hoffman, Jock VanPatten, May 2005

content.description:
Climb up the slab with a difficult starting sequence.

At the 6th bolt the climbing becomes much steeper, but with good holds.   Follow these until a move left allows for a good flake to be reached.

What follows is the crux rightwards traverse to the anchors.   A good exposed finish to the climb.
content.location: Located in the middle of the Left wall.

content.description:
Climb the left facing dihedral with a couple of nice sequences of moves.    At the 3rd bolt the climbing becomes steeper, but on excellent jugs.

Follow the jugs to the top.
content.location: Located on the left side wall of Pub Wall.
